newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk MPs resign from Ciller's conservatives.
newsitem.headline: Turk MPs resign from Ciller's conservatives.

text.p: Two MPs resigned from Tansu Ciller's True Path Party on Monday, the latest in a string of resignations which have sapped the party's parliamentary strength and helped the new secularist government into power.

Dogan Gures, a career army officer who served as Turkey's chief of general staff for four years before becoming an MP in 1995, submitted his resignation early on Monday morning, state-run Anatolian news agency said.
Later Mahmut Yilbas, deputy for the eastern province of Van, also resigned from the party.

Gures said in his letter of resignation, quoted by the agency, he had tried to persuade the pro-Western True Path to enter into coalition with other secularist parties and break its alliance with the Islam-based Welfare Party.

Turkey's new secularist government won a vote of confidence on Saturday, two weeks after the collapse of a coalition between the country's first Islamist prime minister, Necmettin Erbakan, and Ciller's party.

The number of True Path deputies has shrunk from 135 after the last election in 1995 to 96 on Monday as a result of a series of resignations and defections. The latest MPs to quit have not said whether they will join another party.
